general: Implement the 'Soft Utility' design style: Rounded Humanist Sans (Manrope) for headings, Clean Sans (IBM Plex Sans) for body.
Use the 'Bento Grid Mode B' for the Dashboard layout: High density, data correlation, scanability.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do NOT use 'Inter' font for headings.
Follow the 'Swiss & High-Contrast' color archetype with 'Vibrant Play' accents for status.

pages.dashboard: Create a high-density grid with summary cards (Total Bookings, Active Drivers, Revenue) and a main chart (Bookings over time). Use a 'Feed' widget for recent activity.
pages.bookings: Implement a data table with sortable columns, status badges, and a 'Tracing Beam' hover effect on rows. Include a 'New Booking' modal.
pages.drivers: Create a grid of driver cards. Each card should show the driver's avatar, vehicle info, and current status (Available/Busy).
pages.booking_details: A detailed view/modal showing pickup/dropoff map (static image background), customer info, and assigned driver.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
